display.label: Pipedrive
display.description: Manage leads, companies, activities, and more on the Pipedrive platform

inputs.comments: Authorization URL
inputs.label: Authorization URL

inputs.comments: Token URL
inputs.label: Token URL

inputs.comments: Space-delimited scopes
inputs.label: Scopes

inputs.comments: Client identifier
inputs.label: Client ID

inputs.comments: Client secret
inputs.label: Client Secret

documentation.description:
To connect to Pipedrive you will need to create a new sandbox account in their [Developers Corner](https://developers.pipedrive.com/start-here).

Once you have your sandbox account you will need to create a new app at [https://app.pipedrive.com/developer-hub](https://app.pipedrive.com/developer-hub).

Select **Create an App** and then select a **Public app**.
Fill in the minimal required fields and be sure to include Prismatic's OAuth 2.0 **Callback URL**: https<!---->://oauth2.prismatic.io/callback

Update the **Access scopes** to give your app access to the necessary types of data.
Reference [https://pipedrive.readme.io/docs/marketplace-scopes-and-permissions-explanations](https://pipedrive.readme.io/docs/marketplace-scopes-and-permissions-explanations) for information on what permissions your integraiton might need.
Click "Save".

After saving the "OAuth & Access scopes" section will include the **Client ID** and **Client Secret** for your app.

You are now ready to create the OAuth 2.0 connection to Pipedrive within Prismatic:

- Enter the **Client ID** and **Client Secret** values into the same named fields.

Save your integration and you should now be able to connect and authenticate to Pipedrive.

Note that you will need to submit your Pipedrive app for review if you chose "Yes" on the "Intent to publish app" page during app creation.

display.label: Get Activities
display.description: Get all activities assigned to a particular user

inputs.comments: The ID of the user whose activities will be fetched. If omitted, the user associated with the API token will be used. If 0, activities for all company users will be fetched based on the permission sets.
inputs.label: User ID

inputs.comments: The ID of the filter to use (will narrow down results if used together with "user_id" parameter)

inputs.comments: The type of the activity, can be one type or multiple types separated by a comma
inputs.label: Type

inputs.comments: Items shown per page
inputs.label: Limit

inputs.comments: Pagination start
inputs.label: Start

inputs.comments: Use the activity due date where you wish to begin fetching activities from
inputs.label: Start Date

inputs.comments: Use the activity due date where you wish to stop fetching activities from
inputs.label: End Date

inputs.comments: Whether the activity is done or not. 0 = Not done, 1 = Done. If omitted returns both done and not done activities.
inputs.label: Done

inputs.comments: The ID of the activity
inputs.label: Activity ID

inputs.comments: The ID of the activity
inputs.label: Activity ID

display.label: Raw Request
display.description: Send a raw HTTP request to Pipedrive API

inputs.comments: Input the path only (/files), The base URL is already included (https://api.pipedrive.com/v1). For example, to connect to https://api.pipedrive.com/v1/files, only /files is entered in this field.
inputs.label: URL

inputs.comments: The HTTP method to use.
inputs.label: Method

inputs.comments: The HTTP body payload to send to the URL.
inputs.label: Data

inputs.comments: The Form Data to be sent as a multipart form upload.
inputs.label: Form Data

inputs.comments: File Data to be sent as a multipart form upload.
inputs.label: File Data

inputs.comments: A list of query parameters to send with the request. This is the portion at the end of the URL similar to ?key1=value1&key2=value2.
inputs.label: Query Parameter

inputs.comments: A list of headers to send with the request.
inputs.label: Header

inputs.comments: The type of data you expect in the response. You can request json, text, or binary data.
inputs.label: Response Type

inputs.comments: The maximum time that a client will await a response to its request
inputs.label: Timeout

inputs.comments: Enabling this flag will log out the current request.
inputs.label: Debug Request

inputs.comments: The delay in milliseconds between retries.
inputs.label: Retry Delay (ms)

inputs.comments: If true, retries on all erroneous responses regardless of type.
inputs.label: Retry On All Errors

inputs.comments: The maximum number of retries to attempt.
inputs.label: Max Retry Count

inputs.comments: Specifies whether to use a pre-defined exponential backoff strategy for retries.
inputs.label: Use Exponential Backoff

documentation.description: [Pipedrive](https://www.pipedrive.com/) is a sales-focused customer relationship management tool. This component allows you to manage leads, companies, activities, and more.
